body_html:
I was able to reproduce this problem locally with cuda8.0, cudnn5.1 on ubuntu 16.04
For me, it actually also complained about my header files not being there (permission denied)
Until we get to the bottom of this, I was able to create a workaround by making my /usr/local/cuda world read/writeable
$ sudo chmod 777 -R /usr/local/cuda
With this, compilation was OK with my cuda libraries.
I suspect this is a bazel issue?
@damienmg Why does bazel want my cuda headers and .so files to be writeable.
